bibl.title: Letter from Federico Gomez to George A. Kellogg, August 2, 1941

div1.p: Gomez discusses the reactions of Cuban doctors to the Cornwell painting, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever".

div1.head: Letter from Federico Gomez to George A. Kellogg, August 2, 1941
div1.opener:
C O P Y
Representantes Exclusivos de
John Wyeth and Brother
Edificio Kresto
Consulado & 13
B E S T O V P R O D U C T S, S A.
Marianao, Habana
August 2, 1941
Mr. George A. Kellogg
Jersey City, N.J.
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
Thanks a lot for your letter of July 24th with which
you enclosed clippings from the Sunday Mirror with a
very interesting article on the painting “The Conquerors
of Yellow Fever”.

As you know, copy of the painting was sent to Bestov
Products and they ecided to get the reaction to it of
some of the local physicians who classify themselves as
experts in all concerned with Finlay. Two of the doctors
Panchon Dominguez and Horacio Abascal, said that the
painting was disgraceful to Finlay, etc. You will re-
member that Dr. Dominguez was sick at the time you were
here and it was impossible for you to see him. The old
man thinks there is no one in the world who knows more
about Finlay than himself and it is natural that he would
not accept a painting about which he was not consulted.
Dr. Garcia Marruz was favorably impressed with Mr. Corn-
well's art - this was the doctor who gave the Spanish
speech at the banquet and he happens to be the Ministro
de Salubridad now.

I wrote you some time ago about Dr. Fe nando Milanes. He
is the secretary of a joint committee of the Federacion
Medica de Cuba and the Sociedad de Estudios Clinicos de
La Habana who has been collecting the real facts on the
Finlay-Reed argument. Their conclusion is that in Cuba
people try to ignore Reed's technical approach to Finlay's
initial work - and that a painting as the one we have will
go a long way toward bringing both men together and giving
both the credit deserved. If you want, Dr. Milanes can
write an article in his official capacity sponsoring the
painting.

Considering the official standing of Dr. Garcia Marrus at
present and that we can get anything we want from him and
considering that the Federacion Medica de Cuba represents
the opinion of the average Cuban physician, I think that
this is the best chance we can get of bringing the painting
in.
